page.title: 14The School
page.content: There is only one school in the D-Block,called the Burlington School. It was founded in 1877 as an all-age school for the children of the workers at the nearby Burlington Slate quarries, and is now a primary school with about 90 children on roll,boys and girls aged from 4 to 11. It is a church school,being voluntarily controlled by the local Anglican church of St. Cuthbert's,with the local vicar being involved in both teaching and administration. There is no secondary school in the D-Block,but the children (or their parents) do have a choice of secondary schools which they can attend -in Dalton, Ulverston, Coniston, or Barrow.
